reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that they collect personal data from various sources based on the purposes for processing, demonstrating the declaration of data collection.
reply.reference: We collect your personal data from different sources, depending on our purposes for processing personal data. In our business relationships we collect personal data from the contact person of our business partner, our other business partners and public sources (such as the internet and trade register). In other matters we collect personal data from the data subject themselves as well as the means by which they disclose data to us (e.g. LinkedIn or cookies). URL: https://www.brella.io/privacy-notice

source_documents.excerpt:
the data subjects.
Our legal basis for processing personal data depends on the purpose for which we process personal data. Therefore, our legal basis is the performance of a contract in contractual matters, our legitimate interests in recruiting as well as communications and consent in ePrivacy matters (basically meaning cookies).

Brella Ltd's General Privacy Notice
With this Brella Ltd’s General Privacy Notice we provide you information on why and how we process your personal data in our in our general business operations (not including Brella service).
If you would like to know how we process personal data in our Brella service, please have a look at our Brella Service’s Privacy Notice.
1. WHAT DEFINITIONS ARE USED IN THIS PRIVACY NOTICE?
Controller means a party that is in charge of the personal data processing activit...

you have any questions related to your personal data, please be in contact with our acting DPO.
10. CAN THIS PRIVACY NOTICE BE AMENDED?
We have a unilateral right to modify this Privacy Notice. The modifications take effect immediately when we post the up-to-date version of our Privacy Notice to our website.
Last update on 18 November 2023.

means a data protection document that has been drafted according to Articles 13 and 14 of the GDPR, and with which the controller may inform its data subjects of the ways their personal data is processed.
Processor means a party that processes personal data for and on behalf of the controller.
Purpose for processing means the reason why the controller processes personal data of a data subject.

- Right to erasure (art. 17)
- Right to restriction of processing (art. 18)
- Right to data portability (art. 20)

- Automated individual decision-making, including profiling (art. 22)

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects personal data such as contact details, IP addresses, and other data disclosed by the data subjects.

content: Other data disclosed by data subjects

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that the app collects personal data from data subjects for various purposes, including contact details, IP addresses, and other data provided by the users.
reply.reference: We process contact details, IP addresses and other data disclosed to us by the data subjects. URL: https://www.brella.io/privacy-notice

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data by contacting the Data Protection Officer (DPO) at dpo@brella.io or Brella support at support@brella.io.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that users have the ability to request the deletion of their personal data by contacting the Data Protection Officer or Brella support.
reply.reference: You can request for your personal data to be deleted from Brella by contacting our DPO at dpo@brella.io or Brella support at support@brella.io. URL: https://www.brella.io/privacy-notice

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that the app may transfer personal data to third party service providers, such as data storage service providers and communications services providers, ensuring safeguards and personal data processing agreements.
reply.reference: We may transfer your personal data to third party service providers, as it is a normal course of doing business in a digitalized world (i.e. data storage service providers and communications services providers). When personal data is transferred to third parties, we ensure that we conclude adequate personal data processing agreements and safeguards in relation to the data transfers. URL: https://www.brella.io/privacy-notice

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: Brella may share data with third-party service providers involved in data storage and communications services.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions that data may be transferred to third-party service providers, ensuring data processing agreements and safeguards in place.
reply.reference: We may transfer your personal data to third party service providers, as it is a normal course of doing business in a digitalized world (i.e., data storage service providers and communications services providers). When personal data is transferred to third parties, we ensure that we conclude adequate personal data processing agreements and safeguards in relation to the data transfers. URL: https://www.brella.io/privacy-notice
